result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Billie Jo Lentz

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: DPA Final Order
Plea Diversion Final Report
of Expiration of State Public Defender Appointment
Plea Diversion Agreement - 12 months

2:57 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites agreement - defendant will plea to count 1 with a 12 month deferred prosecution agreement and count 2 will be dismissed and read-in.  State concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of GUILTY.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1.  Court orders count 2 be dismissed and read-in.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be withheld and adjourns matter pending compliance with the DPA - 12 months.

Court adjourned at 3:03 p.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 27, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

3:07 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Barb Privat via telephone.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin via telephone.  Statement by Atty Privat has received a copy of the doctor's report and concurs the defendant is competent.  Court questions defendant regarding competency.  Statement by defendant - believes she is competent.  State has received a copy of the doctor's report and is not contesting.  Court re-instates competency.  Statement by Atty Privat - believes a resolution will be reached.  Court sets for Plea & Sentencing on September 27, 2016 at 2:30 p.m.

Court adjourned at 3:09 p.m.
Hearing on September 15, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
to counsel with a copy of the doctor's report

Hearing on September 27, 2016 at 11:00 am.

1:33 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat - has received a copy of the doctor's report.  State has received a copy of the doctor's report.  Court questions the defendant regarding competency.  Court finds the defendant stands mute.  Court finds the defendant to be incompetent.  Statement by ADA - requests defendant go to the outpatient competency restoration program as recommended by the doctor.  Statement by Atty Privat.  Court questions defendant.  Statement by defendant.  Statement by ADA - has charges in Waushara County.  Court makes statement to the defendant - she really needs to meet with the people at the outpatient competency restoration program.  Statement by the Court - will set for status hearing in 3 months - September 27, 2016 at 11:00 a.m.

Court adjourned at 1:41 p.m.
By Atty Barb Privat
Hearing on June 21, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

2:30 p.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by the defendant - has received a copy of the doctor's report but does not understand.  Statement by ADA, has received a copy of the doctor's report.  Court questions defendant regarding counsel.  Defendant to meet with Atty Privat from the PD's office.  Court adjourns matter for approximately 30 days - June 21, 2016 at 1:30 p.m. 

Court adjourned at 2:32 p.m.

**PROCESSING COMPLETE**

No Contact with Berlin Walmart.  Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.  Defendant is to comply with the competency evaluation.  Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.

No Contact with Berlin Walmart.  Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.  Defendant is to comply with the competency evaluation.  Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.

9:06 a.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and requests reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Court instructs the defendant of his/her right to an attorney.  Statement by defendant.  Defendant stands mute.  Court enters a plea of NOT GUILTY on behalf of the defendant.  Court orders a competency evaluation be conducted and a hearing will be scheduled.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $500.00 signature bond and conditions of:  No Contact with Berlin Walmart.  Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.  Defendant is to comply with the competency evaluation.  Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.  Court goes over address and phone number.

Court adjourned at 9:10 a.m.
**PROCESSING NEEDED**
